title: Convert data frame to common units — .unitConverter
code: # small dataframe to illustrate the conversion (df <- dplyr::tibble(   dataType = c(rep("simulated", 3), rep("observed", 3)),   xValues = c(0, 14.482, 28.965, 0, 1, 2),   xUnit = "min",   xDimension = "Time",   yValues = c(1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1),   yUnit = c("mol", "mol", "mol", "g", "g", "g"),   yDimension = c("Amount", "Amount", "Amount", "Mass", "Mass", "Mass"),   yErrorValues = c(2.747, 2.918, 2.746, NA, NA, NA),   yErrorUnit = c("mol", "mol", "mol", "g", "g", "g"),   molWeight = c(10, 10, 20, 20, 20, 10) )) #> # A tibble: 6 x 10 #>   dataType  xValues xUnit xDimension yValues yUnit yDimension yErrorValues #>   <chr>       <dbl> <chr> <chr>        <dbl> <chr> <chr>             <dbl> #> 1 simulated     0   min   Time             1 mol   Amount             2.75 #> 2 simulated    14.5 min   Time             1 mol   Amount             2.92 #> 3 simulated    29.0 min   Time             1 mol   Amount             2.75 #> 4 observed      0   min   Time             1 g     Mass              NA    #> 5 observed      1   min   Time             1 g     Mass              NA    #> 6 observed      2   min   Time             1 g     Mass              NA    #> # ... with 2 more variables: yErrorUnit <chr>, molWeight <dbl>  # default conversion ospsuite:::.unitConverter(df) #> # A tibble: 6 x 10 #>   dataType  xValues xUnit xDimension yValues yUnit yDimension yErrorValues #>   <chr>       <dbl> <chr> <chr>        <dbl> <chr> <chr>             <dbl> #> 1 simulated     0   min   Time            10 g     Amount             27.5 #> 2 simulated    14.5 min   Time            10 g     Amount             29.2 #> 3 simulated    29.0 min   Time            20 g     Amount             54.9 #> 4 observed      0   min   Time             1 g     Mass               NA   #> 5 observed      1   min   Time             1 g     Mass               NA   #> 6 observed      2   min   Time             1 g     Mass               NA   #> # ... with 2 more variables: yErrorUnit <chr>, molWeight <dbl>  # customizing conversion with specified unit(s) ospsuite:::.unitConverter(df, xUnit = ospUnits$Time$h) #> # A tibble: 6 x 10 #>   dataType  xValues xUnit xDimension yValues yUnit yDimension yErrorValues #>   <chr>       <dbl> <chr> <chr>        <dbl> <chr> <chr>             <dbl> #> 1 simulated  0      h     Time            10 g     Amount             27.5 #> 2 simulated  0.241  h     Time            10 g     Amount             29.2 #> 3 simulated  0.483  h     Time            20 g     Amount             54.9 #> 4 observed   0      h     Time             1 g     Mass               NA   #> 5 observed   0.0167 h     Time             1 g     Mass               NA   #> 6 observed   0.0333 h     Time             1 g     Mass               NA   #> # ... with 2 more variables: yErrorUnit <chr>, molWeight <dbl> ospsuite:::.unitConverter(df, yUnit = ospUnits$Mass$kg) #> # A tibble: 6 x 10 #>   dataType  xValues xUnit xDimension yValues yUnit yDimension yErrorValues #>   <chr>       <dbl> <chr> <chr>        <dbl> <chr> <chr>             <dbl> #> 1 simulated     0   min   Time         0.01  kg    Amount           0.0275 #> 2 simulated    14.5 min   Time         0.01  kg    Amount           0.0292 #> 3 simulated    29.0 min   Time         0.02  kg    Amount           0.0549 #> 4 observed      0   min   Time         0.001 kg    Mass            NA      #> 5 observed      1   min   Time         0.001 kg    Mass            NA      #> 6 observed      2   min   Time         0.001 kg    Mass            NA      #> # ... with 2 more variables: yErrorUnit <chr>, molWeight <dbl> ospsuite:::.unitConverter(df, xUnit = ospUnits$Time$s, yUnit = ospUnits$Amount$mmol) #> # A tibble: 6 x 10 #>   dataType  xValues xUnit xDimension yValues yUnit yDimension yErrorValues #>   <chr>       <dbl> <chr> <chr>        <dbl> <chr> <chr>             <dbl> #> 1 simulated      0  s     Time          1000 mmol  Amount             2747 #> 2 simulated    869. s     Time          1000 mmol  Amount             2918 #> 3 simulated   1738. s     Time          1000 mmol  Amount             2746 #> 4 observed       0  s     Time            50 mmol  Mass                 NA #> 5 observed      60  s     Time            50 mmol  Mass                 NA #> 6 observed     120  s     Time           100 mmol  Mass                 NA #> # FALSE, list NA values returned respective path. addMetaData TRUE (default), output list two sublists dataand metaData, latter storing information units dimensions outputs. FALSE, metaData NULL. title: Load a simulation from a pkml file — loadSimulation
text: filePath Full path pkml simulation file load. loadFromCache TRUE, already loaded pkml file loaded , simulation object retrieved cache. FALSE, new simulation object created. Default value FALSE. addToCache TRUE, loaded simulation added cache. FALSE, returned simulation exists locally. Default TRUE. resetIds TRUE, internal object ids simulation reset unique value. FALSE, ids kept defined pkml simulation. Default TRUE.

title: Load a simulation from a pkml file — loadSimulation
code: simPath <- system.file("extdata", "simple.pkml", package = "ospsuite")  # Load sim1 for the first time sim1 <- loadSimulation(simPath)  # sim2 will be loaded from cache and will represent the same object as sim1 sim2 <- loadSimulation(simPath, loadFromCache = TRUE)  parameter1 <- getParameter(toPathString(c("Organism", "Liver", "Volume")), sim1) parameter2 <- getParameter(toPathString(c("Organism", "Liver", "Volume")), sim2)  # parameter1 and parameter2 belong to the same simulation object, so changing # one of the them will also change another setParameterValues(parameters = parameter2, values = 0) parameter1$value == parameter2$value # TRUE #> [1] TRUE  # sim3 will not be loaded from cache sim3 <- loadSimulation(simPath, loadFromCache = FALSE) # parameter3 belong to different simulation object than parameter1 and parameter2 parameter3 <- getParameter(toPathString(c("Organism", "Liver", "Volume")), sim3) setParameterValues(parameters = parameter3, values = 1) parameter2$value == parameter3$value # FALSE#' #> [1] FALSE

title: Runs multiple simulations concurrently. — runSimulations
code: simPath <- system.file("extdata", "simple.pkml", package = "ospsuite") sim <- loadSimulation(simPath)  # Running an individual simulation # Results is a list with one object `SimulationResults` results <- runSimulations(sim)  # Creating custom simulation run options  simRunOptions <- SimulationRunOptions$new() simRunOptions$numberOfCores <- 3 simRunOptions$showProgress <- TRUE  # Running a population simulation popPath <- system.file("extdata", "pop.csv", package = "ospsuite") population <- loadPopulation(popPath) results <- runSimulations(sim, population, simulationRunOptions = simRunOptions)  # Running multiple simulations in parallel sim2 <- loadSimulation(simPath) sim3 <- loadSimulation(simPath)  # Results is an array of `SimulationResults` results <- runSimulations(list(sim, sim2, sim3))

title: SimulationBatch — SimulationBatch
code: \dontrun{ sim1 <- loadSimulation("sim1", loadFromCache = TRUE) sim2 <- loadSimulation("sim2", loadFromCache = TRUE) parameters <- c("Organism|Liver|Volume", "R1|k1") molecules <- "Organism|Liver|A" # Create two simulation batches. simulationBatch1 <- createSimulationBatch(simulation = sim1, parametersOrPaths = parameters, moleculesOrPaths = molecules) simulationBatch2 <- createSimulationBatch(simulation = sim2, parametersOrPaths = parameters, moleculesOrPaths = molecules) #Ids of run values ids <- c() ids[[1]] <- simulationBatch1$addRunValues(parameterValues = c(1, 2), initialValues = 1) ids[[2]] <- simulationBatch1$addRunValues(parameterValues = c(1.6, 2.4), initialValues = 3) ids[[3]] <- simulationBatch2$addRunValues(parameterValues = c(4, 2), initialValues = 4) ids[[4]] <- simulationBatch2$addRunValues(parameterValues = c(2.6, 4.4), initialValues = 5) res <- runSimulationBatches(simulationBatches = list(simulationBatch1, simulationBatch2)) }

title: Converts a value given in a specified unit into the base unit of a quantity — toBaseUnit
code: simPath <- system.file("extdata", "simple.pkml", package = "ospsuite") sim <- loadSimulation(simPath) par <- getParameter("Organism|Liver|Volume", sim)  # Converts the value in unit (1000 ml) to the base unit (l) => 1 valueInBaseUnit <- toBaseUnit(par, 1000, "ml")  valuesInBaseUnit <- toBaseUnit(par, c(1000, 2000, 3000), "ml")

title: Converts a value given in base unit of a quantity into a target unit — toUnit
text: quantityOrDimension Instance quantity dimension retrieved name dimension values Values convert (single vector). sourceUnit specified, values base unit dimension targetUnit Unit convert sourceUnit Optional Name unit convert . NULL (default), values assumed base unit. molWeight Optional molecular weight use converting, example,  molar mass amount concentration. molWeightUnit specified, molWeight assumed kg/µmol molWeightUnit Optional Unit molecular weight value. NULL (default), kg/µmol assumed.

title: Converts a value given in base unit of a quantity into a target unit — toUnit
code: simPath <- system.file("extdata", "simple.pkml", package = "ospsuite") sim <- loadSimulation(simPath) par <- getParameter("Organism|Liver|Volume", sim)  # Converts the value in base unit (1L) to ml => 1000 valueInMl <- toUnit(par, 1, "ml")  valuesInMl <- toUnit(par, c(1, 5, 5), "ml")  # Converts a numerical value in from mmol/l to mg/dl valuesInMgDl <- toUnit(ospDimensions$`Concentration (molar)`, 5,   targetUnit = "mmol/l",   sourceUnit = "mg/dl", molWeight = 180, molWeightUnit = "g/mol" )

code: simPath <- system.file("extdata", "simple.pkml", package = "ospsuite") sim <- loadSimulation(simPath)  parameters <- c(   getParameter(toPathString(c("Organism", "Liver", "Volume")), sim),   getParameter(toPathString(c("Organism", "Liver", "Volume")), sim),   getParameter(toPathString(c("Organism", "TableParameter")), sim) )  # Return a list containing the two parameters 'Volume' and 'Weight (tissue)' uniqueEntities(parameters, CompareBy$id) #> [[1]] #> Parameter:  #>    Path: Organism|Liver|Volume  #>    Value: 10.00 [l]  #>    isConstant: TRUE  #>    isStateVariable: FALSE  #>  #> [[2]] #> Parameter:  #>    Path: Organism|TableParameter  #>    Value: 1.00 [1/min]  #>    isTable: TRUE  #>    XDimension: Time  #>    UseDerivedValues: FALSE  #>   x= 0, y= 1, restartSolver= FALSE #>   x= 10, y= 2, restartSolver= FALSE #>   x= 30, y= 3, restartSolver= FALSE #>   x= 40, y= 4, restartSolver= FALSE #>    Value overrides formula: FALSE  #>    isStateVariable: FALSE  #>

text: startTime Start time minutes calculation PK-Parameter. specified, time start first time point simulation (optional) startTimeOffset Offset minutes apply start time start time application identified  startApplicationIndex. (0 default). endTime End time minutes calculation PK-Parameter. specified, time end last time point simulation (optional) endTimeOffset Offset minutes apply end time start time application identified endApplicationIndex. (0 default). startApplicationIndex 1-based Index application use determine start time calculation PK-Parameter. specified, time start first time point simulation (optional) endApplicationIndex 1-based Index application use determine end time calculation PK-Parameter. specified, time end last time point simulation (optional) normalizationFactor Factor use normalized calculated PK-Parameter. (typically DrugMass, Dose, Dose per bodyweight). responsibility caller ensure value correct unit. (optional) concentrationThreshold Used conjunction threshold parameter type. defined, time concentration reached calculated standardPKParameter Based parameter use perform PK-Analysis calculation. See StandardPKParameter enum possible pk parameters

title: ospsuite 11.0 (development version)
text: Adds new DataCombined class combines observed data (DataSet) simulated data (SimulationResults) single object. Especially important $toDataFrame() method object returns data frame containing combined data observed simulated data, can used visualizations analysis. Adds new visualization functions: plotIndividualTimeProfile() plotPopulationTimeProfile() create time-profile plots. Adds new class DefaultPlotConfiguration provide plot configurations plotting functions. Adds simulationResultsToDataFrame() function convert SimulationResults objects data frame. *ToDataFrame() functions also get *ToTibble() variants extract tibble data frame instead classical data frame.

title: ospsuite 11.0 (development version)
text: Following functions marked deprecation removed future releases: pkAnalysesAsDataFrame() now pkAnalysesToDataFrame() populationAsDataFrame() now populationToDataFrame()

title: ospsuite 11.0 (development version)
text: Signature toUnit function changed. molWeight now fifth, sourceUnit fourth parameter (#837). DataImporterConfiguration: fields timeUnitFromColumn measurementUnitFromColumn renamed isTimeUnitFromColumn isMeasurementUnitFromColumn constructor DataImporterConfiguration accept path configuration file . Use function loadDataImporterConfiguration() create configuration object file. constructor DataSet objects requires name argument. validate*() helper functions "%||%" infix operators longer exported. Please look new utility package, functions now exported: https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite.RUtils/. pkAnalysesAsDataFrame() function changes column data types QuantityPath, Parameter, Unit factor character (https://github.com/Open-Systems-Pharmacology/OSPSuite-R/issues/673).
